title: TKCat User guide
text: Research organizations generate, manage, use knowledge resources can highly heterogenous origin, scope, structure. Making knowledge compliant F...R. (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) principles critical facilitating generation new insights leveraging . aim TKCat (Tailored Knowledge Catalog) R package facilitate management resources frequently used alone combination research environments. TKCat, knowledge resources manipulated modeled database (MDB) objects. objects provide access data tables along general description resource detail data model generated ReDaMoR documenting tables, fields relationships. MDB gathered catalogs can easily explored shared. TKCat provides tools easily subset, filter combine MDBs create new catalogs suited specific needs. Currently, 3 different implementations MDBs supported TKCat: R memory (memoMDB), files (fileMDB) ClickHouse (chMDB). document divided four main sections: first one describes build MDB object, starting minimal example second section shows interact MDB objects extract combine information interest third section focuses use ClickHouse implementation MDB (chMDB) fourth section corresponds appendices providing technical information regarding ClickHouse related admin tasks implementation collections used identify leverage potential relationships different MDBs.

what: Create an MDB: a minimal example
title: TKCat User guide
text: section shows create MDB object starting set tables three steps: Create data model Create validate modeled database (MDB) binding data model dataset Document concept collections can used make bridges across different MDBs example focuses Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO). HPO aims provide standardized vocabulary phenotypic abnormalities encountered human diseases (Köhler et al. 2019).

Also information regarding relationships different tables. model_relational_data() can used improve documentation dataset according know . function raises graphical interface manipulating modifying data model (see ReDaMoR documentation). model get completing using function . model, can see : id primary key HPO_hp table, therefore field must unique; db/id form primary key HPO_diseases table must also unique taken together; fields excepted description (HPO_hp table) complete (NA); HPO_diseaseHP table refers HPO_hp table using HPO_hp fields HPO_diseases table using db id fields (details shown putting cursor edges). Moreover, comments added table field level give better understanding data (shown putting cursor tables).
code: mhpo_dm <- ReDaMoR::df_to_model(HPO_hp, HPO_diseases, HPO_diseaseHP) if(igraph_available){    mhpo_dm %>%       ReDaMoR::auto_layout(lengthMultiplier=80) %>%        plot() }else{    mhpo_dm %>%       plot() } mhpo_dm <- ReDaMoR::model_relational_data(mhpo_dm) plot(mhpo_dm)

text: data model can explicitly bound data MDB (Modeled DataBase) object shown . However, trying build object tables ’ve read data model edited, get following error message. Indeed, according edited model (first one automatically created ReDaMoR), HPO_hp$level field contain integer values HPO_diseases$id HPO_diseaseHP$id fields contain character values. type data among data model features automatically checked building MDB object (along uniqueness NA values example). avoid error, can either change type columns data tables: can use data model read data fileMDB object: read_fileMDB() function identifies text files read path according dataModel. uses types documented data model read files. default, field delimiter \t, another can defined writing delim slot dbInfo parameter (e.g. dbInfo=list(name="miniHPO", delim="\t")). shown message , default, read_fileMDB() perform optional checks (unique fields, nullable fields, foreign keys) checks data 10 first records. code: mhpo_db <- memoMDB(    dataTables=list(       HPO_hp=HPO_hp, HPO_diseases=HPO_diseases, HPO_diseaseHP=HPO_diseaseHP    ),    dataModel=mhpo_dm,    dbInfo=list(name="miniHPO") ) HPO_hp <- mutate(HPO_hp, level=as.integer(level)) HPO_diseases <- mutate(HPO_diseases, id=as.character(id)) HPO_diseaseHP <- mutate(HPO_diseaseHP, id=as.character(id)) mhpo_db <- memoMDB(    dataTables=list(       HPO_hp=HPO_hp, HPO_diseases=HPO_diseases, HPO_diseaseHP=HPO_diseaseHP    ),    dataModel=mhpo_dm,    dbInfo=list(name="miniHPO") ) f_mhpo_db <- read_fileMDB(    path=hpo_data_dir,    dbInfo=list(name="miniHPO"),    dataModel=mhpo_dm ) ## miniHPO ## SUCCESS ##  ## Check configuration ##    - Optional checks:  ##    - Maximum number of records: 10 print(object.size(mhpo_db), units="Kb") ## 691.9 Kb print(object.size(f_mhpo_db), units="Kb") ## 23.5 Kb compare_MDB(former=mhpo_db, new=f_mhpo_db) %>%     DT::datatable(       rownames=FALSE,       width="75%",       options=list(dom="t", pageLength=nrow(.))    )

text: HPO example, one table regards human phenotypes (HPO_hp) another human diseases (HPO_diseases). concepts general referenced many knowledge data resources (e.g. database providing information disease genetics). Therefore, documenting formally concepts help identify connect HPO example resources referencing related concepts. TKCat, central concepts referred members collections. Collections pre-defined members must documented according definition. currently two collections provided within TKCat package: Additional collections can defined users according needs. information collections implementation provided appendix. far, collection member documented HPO example described , indicated “collection member” statement displayed printing object: However, just discussed, HPO_hp table refers human phenotypes HPO_diseases table human diseases. concept corresponds conditions tables can documented member Condition collection. Condition members documented calling add_collection_member() function MDB object. two main arguments name collection name table MDB object. arguments provided depend collection. Condition members, three additional arguments must provided: condition indicate type condition (“Phenotype” “Disease”) source reference source condition identifier identifier condition identifier functions get_local_collection() show_collection_def() can used together identify valid arguments: calling add_collection_member(), arguments must provided list 2 elements named “value” (character) “static” (logical). “static” TRUE, “value” corresponds information shared rows table. “static” FALSE, “value” indicates name column provides information row. example shows HPO_hp table documented member Condition collection. rows table correspond condition type “Phenotype” (condition=list(value="Phenotype", static=TRUE)). phenotype identifiers taken source, “HP” (source=list(value="HP", static=TRUE)). phenotype identifiers provided “id” column table (identifier=list(value="id", static=FALSE)). example shows HPO_disease table documented also member Condition collection. case, source disease identifier can different one row provided “db” column (source=list(value="db", static=FALSE)). Now, existence collection members shown printing MDB object: documented collection members MDB can displayed following: use collection members link integrate different MDBs described later document
code: list_local_collections() ## # A tibble: 2 × 2 ##   title     description                                   ##   <chr>     <chr>                                         ## 1 BE        Collection of biological entity (BE) concepts ## 2 Condition Collection of condition concepts mhpo_db ## memoMDB miniHPO (version 0.1, Patrice Godard): Very small extract of the human phenotype ontology ##    - 3 tables with 10 fields ##  ## No collection member ##  ## For demonstrating ReDaMoR and TKCat capabilities, a very few information from the HPO (human phenotype ontology) has been extracted ## (https://hpo.jax.org/app/) ##  ## Timestamp: 2023-04-13 10:25:09 ## get_local_collection("Condition") %>%    show_collection_def() ## Condition collection: Collection of condition concepts ## Arguments (non-mandatory arguments are between parentheses): ##    - condition: ##       + static: logical ##       + value: character ##    - source: ##       + static: logical ##       + value: character ##    - identifier: ##       + static: logical ##       + value: character mhpo_db$HPO_hp ## # A tibble: 500 × 4 ##    id      name                                              description   level ##    <chr>   <chr>                                             <chr>         <int> ##  1 0000002 Abnormality of body height                        Deviation fr…     3 ##  2 0000009 Functional abnormality of the bladder             Dysfunction …     6 ##  3 0000014 Abnormality of the bladder                        An abnormali…     5 ##  4 0000017 Nocturia                                          Abnormally i…     7 ##  5 0000019 Urinary hesitancy                                 Difficulty i…     7 ##  6 0000021 Megacystis                                        Dilatation o…     8 ##  7 0000022 Abnormality of male internal genitalia            An abnormali…     6 ##  8 0000024 Prostatitis                                       The presence…     8 ##  9 0000025 Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia NA                6 ## 10 0000030 Testicular gonadoblastoma                         The presence…     9 ## # ℹ 490 more rows mhpo_db <- add_collection_member(    mhpo_db, collection="Condition", table="HPO_hp",    condition=list(value="Phenotype", static=TRUE),    source=list(value="HP", static=TRUE),    identifier=list(value="id", static=FALSE) ) mhpo_db <- add_collection_member(    mhpo_db, collection="Condition", table="HPO_diseases",    condition=list(value="Disease", static=TRUE),    source=list(value="db", static=FALSE),    identifier=list(value="id", static=FALSE) ) mhpo_db ## memoMDB miniHPO (version 0.1, Patrice Godard): Very small extract of the human phenotype ontology ##    - 3 tables with 10 fields ##  ## Collection members:  ##    - 2 Condition members ##  ## For demonstrating ReDaMoR and TKCat capabilities, a very few information from the HPO (human phenotype ontology) has been extracted ## (https://hpo.jax.org/app/) ##  ## Timestamp: 2023-04-13 10:25:09 ## collection_members(mhpo_db) ## # A tibble: 6 × 9 ##   collection cid                   resource   mid table field static value type  ##   <chr>      <chr>                 <chr>    <int> <chr> <chr> <lgl>  <chr> <chr> ## 1 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      1 HPO_… cond… TRUE   Phen… NA    ## 2 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      1 HPO_… sour… TRUE   HP    NA    ## 3 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      1 HPO_… iden… FALSE  id    NA    ## 4 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      2 HPO_… cond… TRUE   Dise… NA    ## 5 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      2 HPO_… sour… FALSE  db    NA    ## 6 Condition  miniHPO_Condition_1.0 miniHPO      2 HPO_… iden… FALSE  id    NA

code: file_hpo <- read_fileMDB(    path=system.file("examples/HPO-subset", package="ReDaMoR"),    dataModel=system.file("examples/HPO-model.json", package="ReDaMoR"),    dbInfo=list(       "name"="HPO",       "title"="Data extracted from the HPO database",       "description"=paste(          "This is a very small subset of the HPO!",          "Visit the reference URL for more information."       ),       "url"="http://human-phenotype-ontology.github.io/"    ) ) ## HPO ## SUCCESS ##  ## Check configuration ##    - Optional checks:  ##    - Maximum number of records: 10 plot(data_model(file_hpo)) file_hpo <- file_hpo %>%     add_collection_member(       collection="Condition", table="HPO_hp",       condition=list(value="Phenotype", static=TRUE),       source=list(value="HP", static=TRUE),       identifier=list(value="id", static=FALSE)    ) %>%     add_collection_member(       collection="Condition", table="HPO_diseases",       condition=list(value="Disease", static=TRUE),       source=list(value="db", static=FALSE),       identifier=list(value="id", static=FALSE)    )

text: explained , databases refer concepts integrated accordingly. However often use different vocabularies. example, CHEMBL ClinVar refer biological entities () documenting drug targets disease causal genes. CHEMBL refers drug target CHEMBL_component_sequence table using mainly Uniprot peptide identifiers different species. Whereas ClinVar refers causal genes entrezNames table using human Entrez gene identifiers. Since peptides coded genes, biological relationship two types , several tools exist convert identifiers one scope (e.g. BED (Godard Eyll 2018), mygene (Wu, MacLeod, Su 2012), biomaRt (Kinsella et al. 2011)). TKCat provides mechanism document scopes order allow automatic conversions . concepts called Collections TKCat formally defined able document members. Two collection definitions provided within TKCat package can imported import_local_collection() function. definition collection members provided CHEMBL_component_sequence entrezNames tables. Collection column indicates collection table refers. cid column indicates version collection definition correspond $id JSON schema. resource column indicates name resource mid column identifier unique member collection resource. field column indicates part scope collection. case , 4 fields documented: : type (e.g. Gene Peptide) source: source identifier (e.g. EntrezGene Peptide) organism: organism identifier refers (e.g Homo sapiens) identifier: identifier . fields can static . TRUE means value field records provided value column. Whereas FALSE means value can different record provided column name given value column. type column used organism field case collection can take 2 values: “Scientific name” “NCBI taxon identifier”. definition pre-build collection members follows terminology used BED package (Godard Eyll 2018). can adapted according solution chosen converting identifiers one scope another. Setting definition scope done using add_collection_member() function shown minimal example Reading HPO example.

text: aim collections identify potential bridges MDBs. get_shared_collection() function used list collections shared two MDBs. example, 3 different ways merge two MDBs filtered_clinvar file_chembl: Based conditions provided respectively traits CHEMBL_drug_indication tables Based conditions provided respectively traitsCref CHEMBL_drug_indication tables Based provided respectively entrezNames CHEMBL_component_sequence tables code shows merge two resources based information. achieve task relies function provided TKCat along collection definition (get function: get_collection_mapper("")). function uses BED package (Godard Eyll 2018) need package installed connection BED database order run code . returned object metaMDB gathering original MDBs relational table members collection defined parameter. Additional information collection can found appendix.
code: get_shared_collections(filtered_clinvar, file_chembl) ## # A tibble: 3 × 5 ##   collection table.x     mid.x table.y                   mid.y ##   <chr>      <chr>       <int> <chr>                     <int> ## 1 Condition  traits          2 CHEMBL_drug_indication        1 ## 2 Condition  traitCref       1 CHEMBL_drug_indication        1 ## 3 BE         entrezNames     1 CHEMBL_component_sequence     1 bedCheck <- try(BED::checkBedConn()) ## BED is not connected. ## You can connect to a BED database instance using the connectToBed function. if(!inherits(bedCheck, "try-error") && bedCheck){    sel_coll <- get_shared_collections(file_clinvar, file_chembl) %>%        filter(collection=="BE")    filtered_cv_chembl <- merge(       x=file_clinvar,       y=file_chembl,       by=sel_coll,       dmAutoLayout=igraph_available    ) }

text: collection defined JSON document. document fulfill requirements defined Collection-Schema.json. Two collections available default TKCat package. collection defined. collection refer "TKCat_collections_1.0" $schema. following properties: $id: identifier collection title: title collection type: always object description: short description collection properties: properties provided collection members. case: $schema: $id collection $id: identifier collection member: string collection: “” resource: name resource collection members: string tables: array tables corresponding collection members. item table following features: name: name table fields: required fields : static true value correspond value valid records. value correspond table column value record. source: static true value correspond source value valid records. value correspond table column source value record. organism: static true value correspond organism value valid records. value correspond table column organism value record. type indicate organisms identified: "Scientific name" "NCBI taxon identifier". main specifications defined JSON document can simply displayed R session calling show_collection_def() function.
code: list_local_collections() ## # A tibble: 2 × 2 ##   title     description                                   ##   <chr>     <chr>                                         ## 1 BE        Collection of biological entity (BE) concepts ## 2 Condition Collection of condition concepts get_local_collection("BE") {    "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/schema",    "$id":"TKCat_BE_collection_1.0",     "title": "BE collection",     "type": "object",     "description": "Collection of biological entity (BE) concepts",     "properties": {       "$schema": {"enum": ["TKCat_BE_collection_1.0"]},       "$id": {"type": "string"},         "collection": {"enum":["BE"]},         "resource": {"type": "string"},         "tables": {             "type": "array", arguments are between parentheses): ##    - be: ##       + static: logical ##       + value: character ##    - source: ##       + static: logical ##       + value: character ##    - (organism): ## title: TKCat User guide
text: merge.MDB() map_collection_members() functions rely functions map members collection. recorded (using import_collection_mapper() function), functions can automatically identified TKCat, otherwise according user needs, functions provided using funs (merge.MDB()) fun (map_collection_members()) parameters. Two mappers pre-recorded TKCat, one collection one Condition collection. can retrieved get_collection_mapper() function. mapper function must least x y parameters. data.frame field values corresponding fields defined collection. Additional parameters can defined forwarded using .... function return data frame fields values followed “_x” “_y” suffix accordingly.
code: get_collection_mapper("BE") function (x, y, orthologs = FALSE, restricted = FALSE, ...)  {     if (!requireNamespace("BED")) {         stop("The BED package is required")     }     if (!BED::checkBedConn()) {         stop("You need to connect to a BED database using", " the BED::connectToBed() function")     }     if (!"organism" %in% colnames(x)) {         d <- x         scopes <- dplyr::distinct(d, be, source)         nd <- c()         for (i in 1:nrow(scopes)) {             be <- scopes$be[i]             source <- scopes$source[i]             toadd <- d %>% dplyr::filter(be == be, source ==                  source)             organism <- BED::guessIdScope(toadd$identifier, be = be,                  source = source, tcLim = Inf) %>% attr("details") %>%                  filter(be == !!be & source == !!source) %>% pull(organism) %>%                  unique()             toadd <- merge(toadd, tibble(organism = organism))             nd <- bind_rows(nd, toadd)         }         x <- nd %>% mutate(organism_type = "Scientific name")     }     if (!"organism" %in% colnames(y)) {         d <- y         scopes <- dplyr::distinct(d, be, source)         nd <- c()         for (i in 1:nrow(scopes)) {             be <- scopes$be[i]             source <- scopes$source[i]             toadd <- d %>% dplyr::filter(be == be, source ==                  source)             organism <- BED::guessIdScope(toadd$identifier, be = be,                  source = source, tcLim = Inf) %>% attr("details") %>%                  filter(be == !!be & source == !!source) %>% pull(organism) %>%                  unique()             toadd <- merge(toadd, tibble(organism = organism))             nd <- bind_rows(nd, toadd)         }         y <- nd %>% mutate(organism_type = "Scientific name")     }     xscopes <- dplyr::distinct(x, be, source, organism, organism_type)     yscopes <- dplyr::distinct(y, be, source, organism, organism_type)     toRet <- NULL     for (i in 1:nrow(xscopes)) {         xscope <- xscopes[i, ]         if (any(apply(xscope, 2, is.na))) {             (next)()         }         xi <- dplyr::right_join(x, xscope, by = c("be", "source",              "organism", "organism_type"))         xorg <- ifelse(xscope$organism_type == "NCBI taxon identifier",              BED::getOrgNames(xscope$organism) %>% dplyr::filter(nameClass ==                  "scientific name") %>% dplyr::pull(name), xscope$organism)         for (j in 1:nrow(yscopes)) {             yscope <- yscopes[j, ]             if (any(apply(yscope, 2, is.na))) {                 (next)()             }             yi <- dplyr::right_join(y, yscope, by = c("be", "source",                  "organism", "organism_type"))             yorg <- ifelse(yscope$organism_type == "NCBI taxon identifier",                  BED::getOrgNames(yscope$organism) %>% dplyr::filter(nameClass ==                    "scientific name") %>% dplyr::pull(name), yscope$organism)             if (xorg == yorg || orthologs) {                 xy <- BED::convBeIds(ids = xi$identifier, from = xscope$be,                    from.source = xscope$source, from.org = xorg,                    to = yscope$be, to.source = yscope$source,                    to.org = yorg, restricted = restricted) %>%                    dplyr::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::select(from,                    to)                 if (restricted) {                   xy <- dplyr::bind_rows(xy, BED::convBeIds(ids = yi$identifier,                      from = yscope$be, from.source = yscope$source,                      from.org = yorg, to = xscope$be, to.source = xscope$source,                      to.org = xorg, restricted = restricted) %>%                      dplyr::as_tibble() %>% dplyr::select(to = from,                      from = to))                 }                 xy <- xy %>% dplyr::rename(identifier_x = "from",                    identifier_y = "to") %>% dplyr::mutate(be_x = xscope$be,                    source_x = xscope$source, organism_x = xscope$organism,                    be_y = yscope$be, source_y = yscope$source,                    organism_y = yscope$organism)                 toRet <- dplyr::bind_rows(toRet, xy)             }         }     }     toRet <- dplyr::distinct(toRet)     return(toRet) }

previous_headings: Appendices > Remarks about supported data format and data types
title: TKCat User guide
text: ReDaMoR TKCat support data frame matrix objectq. Data frame used data format far. However, matrices values can useful use cases. example shows data format modeled ReDaMoR 3 columns table: one type “row” corresponding row names matrix, one type “column” corresponding column names matrix, one type (excepted “row”, “column”, “base64”).
code: d <- matrix(    rnorm(40), nrow=10,    dimnames=list(       paste0("g", 1:10),       paste0("s", 1:4)    ) ) m <- ReDaMoR::df_to_model(d) %>%     ReDaMoR::rename_field("d", "row", "gene") %>%    update_field("d", "gene", comment="Gene identifier") %>%     ReDaMoR::rename_field("d", "column", "sample") %>%     update_field("d", "sample", comment="Sample identifier") %>%     ReDaMoR::rename_field("d", "value", "expression") %>%     update_field(       "d", "expression", nullable=FALSE, comment="Gene expression value"    ) md <- memoMDB(list(d=d), m, list(name="Matrix example")) plot(data_model(md))

previous_headings: Appendices > Remarks about supported data format and data types
title: TKCat User guide
text: Whole documents can stored MDB “base64” character values. example shows document can put table corresponding data model.
code: ch_config_files <- tibble(    name=c("config.xml", "users.xml"),    file=c(       base64enc::base64encode(          system.file("ClickHouse/config.xml", package="TKCat")       ),       base64enc::base64encode(          system.file("ClickHouse/users.xml", package="TKCat")       )    ) ) m <- df_to_model(ch_config_files) %>%     update_field(       "ch_config_files", "name",       type="base64", comment="Name of the config file",       nullable=FALSE, unique=TRUE    ) %>%     update_field(       "ch_config_files", "file",       type="base64", comment="Config file in base64 format",       nullable=FALSE    ) md <- memoMDB(    list(ch_config_files=ch_config_files), m, list(name="base64 example") ) plot(data_model(md))

TKCat supports ClickHouse system ClickHouseHTTP RClickhouse packages. TKCat implements 3 main types MDB based files, memory tables ClickHouse database. also provides mechanisms automatically convert implementations. TKCat supports catalogs MDBs facilitating exploration existing data. also allows integration different MDBs automatic identification similar concepts (Collections) automatic conversion different vocabulary rely.

title: An MDB (Modeled DataBase) based on files: fileMDB — $.chMDB
code: hpof <- read_fileMDB(    path=system.file("examples/HPO-subset", package="ReDaMoR"),    dataModel=system.file("examples/HPO-model.json", package="ReDaMoR"),    dbInfo=list(       "name"="HPO",       "title"="Data extracted from the HPO database",       "description"=paste(          "This is a very small subset of the HPO!",          "Visit the reference URL for more information"       ),       "url"="http://human-phenotype-ontology.github.io/"    ) ) #> HPO #> SUCCESS #>  #> Check configuration #>    - Optional checks:  #>    - Maximum number of records: 10 count_records(hpof) #>              HPO_hp           HPO_altId     HPO_sourceFiles        HPO_diseases  #>                 500                  89                   2                1903  #>       HPO_diseaseHP HPO_diseaseSynonyms         HPO_parents     HPO_descendants  #>                2594                2337                  95                 972  #>        HPO_synonyms  #>                 730   ## The following commands take time on fileMDB object if (FALSE) {  select(hpof, HPO_hp:HPO_diseases) toTake <- "HPO_altId" select(hpof, all_of(toTake))  hpoSlice <- slice(hpof, HPO_diseases=1:10) count_records(hpoSlice)  if("stringr" %in% installed.packages()[,"Package"]){    epilHP <- filter(       hpof,       HPO_diseases=stringr::str_detect(          label, stringr::regex("epilepsy", ignore_case=TRUE)       )    )    count_records(epilHP)    label <- "Rolandic epilepsy"    cn <- sym("label")    reHP <- filter(       hpof,       HPO_diseases=!!cn==!!label    ) }  }
